article.headline: UC-Santa Barbara 89, Pepperdine 80
article.story: SANTA BARBARA (AP) -- Brandon Heath scored 23 of his 29 points in the second half to rally unbeaten San Diego State to a 76-72 victory at UC Santa Barbara. Heath, the Mountain West Conference MVP last year, made 5-of-8 shots from the 3-point line and also had four steals for the Aztecs (7-0). Alex Harris led the Gauchos (4-1) with 21 points and six assists. His hook shot with 11:53 to go gave them their biggest lead of the game, at 48-40. But Heath responded with a rare four-point play just 18 seconds later. Harris' three-point play kept UCSB up by seven, 55-48, with 9:45 remaining, but a tip in by Lorenzo Wade sparked a 10-0 run for the Aztecs. Wade finished with 13 points, while Mohamed Abukar (14 points, nine rebounds) and Jerome Habel (14 points, seven rebounds) led San Diego State up front. James Powell scored 12 of his 16 points in the first half to lead the Gauchos to a 31-29 lead. Chris Devine, UCSB's leader in rebounds with seven, scored 10 of his 14 points in the second half. Justin Joyner added 11 points.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
